00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Interval class
00004 #
00005 package Parser::List::Interval;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check that the number of endpoints is OK
00011 #  And that they are numbers or infinity.
00012 #
00013 sub _check {
00014   my $self = shift;
00015   my $length = $self->{type}{length}; my $coords = $self->{coords};
00016   $self->Error("Intervals can have only two endpoints") if $length > 2;
00017   $self->Error("Intervals must have two endpoints") if $length < 2;
00018   $self->Error("Coordinates of intervals can only be numbers or infinity")
00019     if (!$coords->[0]->isNumOrInfinity || !$coords->[1]->isNumOrInfinity) &&
00020       !$self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00021   $self->Error("The left endpoint of an interval can't be positive infinity")
00022     if $coords->[0]{isInfinity};
00023   $self->Error("The right endpoint of an interval can't be negative infinity")
00024     if $coords->[1]{isNegativeInfinity};
00025   $self->Error("Infinite endpoints must be open")
00026     if ($self->{open} ne '(' && $coords->[0]{isInfinite}) ||
00027        ($self->{close} ne ')' && $coords->[1]{isInfinite});
00028 }
00029 
00030 sub canBeInUnion {1}
00031 
00032 #
00033 #  Use the Value.pm class to produce the result
00034 #
00035 sub _eval {
00036   my $self = shift; my @ab = @{(shift)};
00037   $self->Package($self->type)->new($self->context,$self->{open},@ab,$self->{close});
00038 }
00039 
00040 #
00041 #  Insert appropriate Value.pm calls to generate the result.
00042 #
00043 sub perl {
00044   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift;
00045   my $perl; my @p = ();
00046   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@p,$x->perl)}
00047   $perl = $self->Package($self->type).'->new('.join(',',"'".$self->{open}."'",@p,"'".$self->{close}."'").')';
00048   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00049   return $perl;
00050 }
